About Catalyst

The Concentrix Catalyst team leads the experience design and engineering at Concentrix, with a footprint of 22 global offices and 11 global delivery centres.

We are thinkers, designers, makers, and builders. Our team of engineers globally is focused on driving business outcomes for the world's most customer-obsessed companies. We combine great design and leading-edge technologies to create significant, enduring, and high-impact experiences for brands and their customers.

Since our founding, we've worked hard to build a place of belonging and responsibility. We're committed to cultivating diverse perspectives, running our global business sustainably, and uplifting our communities however we can. We take pride in our staff's experiences as we invest in their learning and future. Professional development encompasses everything you do in your role, from hands-on experience and exposure to new challenges to mentorship, supplemental courses, and training.

data.job_description:
Say hello to MobileCoin, the only sustainable payments platform that’s fast and simple enough for everyday private payments.

We’ve developed a fully private, distributed payments platform you can use every day to pay for anything while protecting your privacy and data. Though based on a cryptocurrency, the barrier to understanding, buying, and using crypto is huge for many, and we want to remove that barrier. It’s cryptocurrency designed to be used for secure payments, not to replace a currency, and we like to think it’s crypto that anyone can use. In a sense, MobileCoin is made for everyone.

MobileCoin is a private payment system that works directly with messaging apps on your phone or desktop. We want to empower each individual with the tools they need to communicate and connect. Through our encrypted blockchain payment system, MobileCoin gives you the ability to transact in private. In a world where your personal data is seen as a commodity, we believe that privacy should be a choice, and we choose to help protect that choice.

Your Role:

We are looking for a Flutter Developer to join our team! As a software engineer, you will work on our mobile wallet solutions. This is a rare opportunity to join a well-positioned team at an early stage to deliver immediate, measurable and long-lasting impact. You will gain exposure to many aspects of developing cryptographic and financial primitives and work alongside individuals with proven experience building some of the most innovative blockchain technologies in the world.

Responsibilities:
• Develop and test application features and product use cases
• Deploy beta builds internally
• Deploy production builds into the App Store and Google Play
• Collaborate with the platform team at MobileCoin

Required Skills, Qualifications and Experience:
• Minimum 4 years of software engineering experience
• Minimum 1 year of Flutter development experience
• Solid Dart language skills
• Experience in building cross-platform UI (iOS/Android)
• Experience writing networking code
• Ability to take on complex and ambiguous problems

Preferred Skills, Qualifications and Experience:
• Flutter plugin development
• iOS/Android development experience
• TestFlight/Google Play deployments
• Understanding application UI design systems
• Understanding cryptocurrency space

Benefits:
• Competitive Salary (based on experience)
• Equity
• Annual bonus
• Blue-chip Healthcare Benefits
• Monthly Wellness, Food, Education & Tech Stipend
• 401k Matching
• Unlimited PTO
• Unique opportunity to be an early part of a fast-growing Silicon Valley “unicorn”

Location: Open to remote candidates in the US

MobileCoin Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.

Colorado, New York, Washington, and California Pay Law

The target annual pay range for this position in Colorado, New York, Washington and California can range from $160,000 to $200,000 + target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401k), however, base pay offered may vary depending on skills, level, experience, job-related knowledge and location.

We are currently seeking a talented Flutter Frontend Developer with expertise in Flutter, GraphQL, and TypeScript to join our team. As a Flutter Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for developing engaging and user-friendly mobile applications using Flutter framework and integrating with GraphQL APIs.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with the development team to design and develop highly interactive and visually appealing mobile applications using Flutter and Dart.
• Implement responsive UI components, animations, and transitions to deliver a seamless user experience across multiple devices and screen sizes.
• Integrate with GraphQL APIs to fetch and manipulate data efficiently.
• Write clean, modular, and maintainable code following best practices and coding standards.
• Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the reliability and performance of the frontend applications.
• Collaborate with backend developers, designers, and other stakeholders to understand and implement requirements effectively.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in mobile app development, Flutter, and GraphQL.

Requirements:
• Strong expertise in Flutter and Dart programming language.
• Solid understanding and practical experience with GraphQL and its integration with Flutter applications.
• Proficiency in TypeScript, as it is commonly used with Flutter for static typing and code organization.
• Experience in building responsive UI layouts, animations, and transitions using Flutter's widget system.
• Familiarity with state management solutions in Flutter such as Provider, Bloc, or Riverpod.
• Knowledge of GraphQL query language and working with GraphQL APIs for data retrieval and mutation.
• Experience with version control systems, particularly Git, and collaborative development workflows (e.g., GitFlow).
• Familiarity with mobile app testing frameworks and tools for unit testing and integration testing.
• Good problem-solving skills and ability to debug and resolve issues in a timely manner.
• Excellent communication and teamwork skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

If you are a talented Flutter Frontend Developer excited about creating exceptional mobile applications and passionate about leveraging GraphQL, please apply with your updated resume and examples of your previous Flutter projects.

Note: This position offers equity in our company in lieu of monetary compensation. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the success of our venture and benefit from the growth and value created.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Benefits:
• Flexible schedule
• Paid time off

• Yearly pay

Description

At Locals, We empower creators to be independent.

Founded in 2019 and based in New York, Locals is a platform that empowers independent content creators to publish their content, engage with their supporters, and make money from subscriptions (and not ads), on their own terms.On Locals.com, Creators significantly outperform other platforms in conversion rate to paid, subscription earnings, and positive sentiment.

About the role:

We are looking for a Senior Flutter Developer to join our application engineering team to further develop our applications on Android, iOS, and iPadOS platforms. You will be responsible for feature development and maintaining existing applications including work on improving the architecture, the UI/UX, and general application code working against an existing backend system. Working closely with product management and the lead application dev eloper, you will be crafting an application for use by millions of users

What you’ll be doing:
• Work closely with the designers, product managers, and engineering leadership to build a high quality user experience.
• Extend and improve existing applications, working closely with other application and backend developers.
• Work in Flutter across Android, iOS, and iPadOS platforms.
• Optimize applications for various device form factors.
• Develop test infrastructure ensuring application quality.
• Other duties as assigned.

What you bring to the table:
• 3+ years overall development experience, 2+ years with Flutter and Dart experience.
• Experience building Flutter applications on Android and iOS/iPadOS platforms.
• Experience working across a wide variety of form factors including phones and tablets.
• Strong understanding of Flutter SDK and device neutral code.
• Understanding of background task management with isolates, streams, and other Flutter/Dart primitives.
• Experience building entire applications, and examples of your previous published works.
• Experience building high quality apps, supported by strong tests, and using performance and leak evaluation tools.
• Strong communicator who collaborates well with cross functional teams.
• Familiar with agile processes, continuous integration, and working with a remote team

EEO Statement:

Locals is an equal opportunity employer. We promote an equal playing field where everyone has the same opportunities regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time. Required to extensively talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to walk; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop and kneel. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

100% remote position available.

United States, Georgia, Atlanta area candidate preferred

OXOS Medical, Inc. is a fast-growing medical technology startup that is revolutionizing radiology with its FDA cleared, handheld, digital X-ray imaging system, the Micro C®. OXOS Medical puts the future of x-ray in the palm of your hand with unprecedented safety and speed. We enable anyone anywhere to access radiologic diagnostics at the point of care, expanding availability and changing the way healthcare is delivered.

OXOS Medical is constantly innovating, building on our best-in-class imaging device, expanding into cloud-based imaging platforms, robotic guided imaging, intraoperative computed tomography, and telemedical solutions. OXOS Medical has raised $45M to date from prominent MedTech investors, venture capital firms, and renowned orthopedic surgeons.

OXOS is searching for a Flutter Mobile/Web Developer for the front-end UI/UX of our flagship telemedicine and portal applications. The OXOS platform connects our hardware medical devices, medical software processing, and front-end telemedicine and portal applications. The position includes evaluating multi-platform development technologies and libraries as well as defining application architecture. After choosing technologies, the candidate will develop a multi-platform code base that generates a web, iOS, and android application. Additionally, the candidate will also contribute feedback and recommendations for dev ops features and implementations.

OXOS is searching for candidates that are seasoned and passionate front-end developers with in-depth skills in multi-platform development. The candidate should be comfortable with providing guidance, strategy, and deciding on best practices for our front-end applications.

The complete front-end solution will utilize a combination of the following skills and experience. Candidates with all skills preferred, but not required.

Technologies: flutter, android, iOS, web, linux, oauth

Languages: dart, java, kotlin, swift, objective c, javascript, HTML5, bash

Regulations (a plus): HIPAA, IEC 62304, HiTrust

Responsibilities
• Design and implement a multi-platform application targeting web and mobile platforms.
• Develop the logical and technical architecture for the client applications.
• Provide hands-on development.
• Evaluate new and existing client technologies and methodologies.
• Serving as leader and subject matter expert in front-end application development.
• Recommend improvements to technology and processes that increase the effectiveness of the team.
• Creates proof of concepts to determine the viability of new or different technologies.
• Provide mentorship for senior engineers and leaders.
• Help recruit world-class engineering talent.
• Facilitate collaborative design discussions and drive design reviews.

Qualifications
• This is mid-level position and only experienced developers should apply.
• BS/MS in Computer Science related field or equivalent related professional experience.

data.job_title: Front-end Flutter Developer - Livestock, Poultry and Dairy
data.job_description:
The IDEXX Livestock, Poultry, and Dairy division offers diagnostic tests and services to monitor the health of herd and flock animals worldwide. We partner with state, government, and private laboratories to provide producers (farmers) with results that protect human health, improve animal productivity, and ensure food quality.

As a Front-end Flutter Developer, you will work closely with an experienced platform team of architects and developers working on diagnostic systems and applications at IDEXX. This is an exciting opportunity to be a key member of a team responsible for developing products and services that are used by our global customers in the Livestock, Poultry and Dairy (LPD) industry segment.

The team works as squad of 7-8 people, encompassing Front-end and Back-end developers, User Experience Design, Business Analysts, Instrument Connectivity, Quality Engineering and DevOps.

The team is distributed and works remotely

The team works closely with our Product team and key customers, as we define new platform capabilities and features for their production facilities

The team works within IDEXX IT, to create scalable, high-quality diagnostic software solutions that leverage the breadth and expertise of IDEXX globally

What will you need to succeed:

You are someone with 5 years of front-end design and development experience. Preferable 3 years within the Flutter ecosystem

You’ve successfully built and delivered applications and associated components with an Interactive Flutter UI

You work well with experienced product development teams, where you are responsible for UI development, code integration and defect management.

You work well with your Quality Engineering counterparts on test strategy, implementation, and regression automation opportunities.

Your application development meets functional specifications, ensuring that the design integrates with other related systems efficiently and reliably together.

You have familiarity with web and desktop development and designing for performance.

You are passionate about technology and end user experience.

You have working knowledge of the Agile development processes. You have experience maintaining and enhancing story estimates and can track the time required to complete the work for project management and financial tracking purposes.

You’ve developed applications from ideation to production-release, along with continued updates, new features, defect management and releases.

You’ve worked in a software development lifecycle for customer-facing products.

You have experience with our other technologies and platform services (SyncFusion, Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, RESTful APIs, DevOps practices, AWS)

You can demonstrate your ability to work efficiently, and collaboratively in small remote teams.

You have strong interpersonal skills and can communicate effectively.

You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Why IDEXX?

We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people.

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.

Let’s pursue what matters together.

What you can expect from us:

Base annual salary target: $90,000 - $120,000 (yes, we do have flexibility if needed)

Opportunity for annual cash bonus

Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day-One

5% matching 401k

Additional benefits including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more!

IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

About Kyla

Kyla helps you live longer. First, Kyla collects your medical history, blood sample, and DNA. Then, Kyla AI analyzes your medical data to identify your top health risks, estimate your remaining lifetime, and give you simple, doctor-validated daily goals to increase your life expectancy. Finally, Kyla monitors your progress 24×7, diagnoses, and treats your conditions with the help of doctors.

Join our Kyla.com team of medical providers, product leaders, engineers, and AI scientists to grant people the power to understand their health from a new perspective in order to improve their life expectancy. About the Company:

We are a US-based, well-funded HealthTech start-up built out of analysis to modernize

healthcare and wellness, currently penetrating our roots in the US & Canadian markets. At LYBL

we aim to create a one-stop shop for all wellness needs of an individual and provide affordable

& accessible integrative medicine for everyone.
• *

Job Overview:**

We are hiring a Flutter developer to engineer applications that will run across Android, iOS, and the web.We are looking for someone passionate about performance, reliability, and design with the experience and credentials to back up that passion. Someone who can take ownership of applications, solve technical challenges and take pride in their solutions and code.

Experience required: 4+ years

Job Location: Delhi NCR

You are a good fit if You:

Have worked on flutter for 3+ years

Know releasing multiple apps on various platforms (android, ios, web)

Know debugging of apps for memory leaks and optimizations

Have written bridges to make sure that native functions are available on Android/iOS

Managed to publish apps on respective store (Google play store and Apple store) platforms

What you’ll do?:

➔ You will be building and shipping robust apps to Android/ iOS devices using a single codebase.

➔ You will be writing readable and clear code using Dart that will be extensively documented for

future use and upgrades.

➔ You will be sharing feedback and brainstorming ideas with teams to improve the development

process.

➔ Understand basic concepts of design for developing user-friendly applications.

➔ Stay up to date with the latest technologies.

What do you need for this Role?:

Experience in the development of Android/iOS applications and have deployed them on Google

Play/App Store.

4+ years of knowledge in mobile app development.

In-depth understanding of front-end languages like HTML, CSS,3, and JavaScript.

In-depth understanding of Object Oriented programming languages like Java and C++.

Familiarity using version control tools like Git, Subversion, etc, and IDEs like Android Studio, VS

Code, etc.

Understanding of the Agile Software Development Life Cycle and being exposed to Scrum

projects.

Knowledge of Dart programming language, Rest APIs, and integration of various APIs from third

parties.

Comfortable using test cases for debugging code, enhancing performance and reliability.

Live your best life focuses on Healthcare. Their company has offices in California and Noida. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.lybl.com/
